revised_title: Analyzing Non-Identifiability in Single Channel Inference Models
tldr: The authors investigate non-identifiability in single channel inference models, specifically focusing on ion channel kinetics and Markov models. They analyze a two-state class model and discuss the implications of non-identifiability on the determination of kinetic parameters from density functions. The study highlights the importance of understanding model properties to avoid misinterpretation of data in patch clamp experiments.
